info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:25PM EDT until July 02 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BERKS AND CENTRAL LEHIGH COUNTIES... At 624 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Kutztown, or 14 miles west of Allentown, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported a funnel cloud. At 6:18 PM, video was received of a funnel cloud within the tornado warned storm. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Emmaus, Kutztown, Topton, Ancient Oaks, Claussville, Macungie and Alburtis. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 50 and 60. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 42 and 57. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
